Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Chronic CYP administration significantly ( P < or = . 002 ) increased bladder weight by 60 % and increased ( 7 - to 11 - fold ) the numbers of NOS - immunoreactive ( IR ) afferent neurons in the L6 - S1 DRG .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Chronic CYP administration |

Note: Although "Chronic CYP administration" is not a disease in the traditional sense, it is still considered a "Disease" entity in this paragraph as it refers to a chronic condition caused by the administration of a certain compound (CYP), which has significant effects on bladder weight and numbers of NOS-immunoreactive (IR) afferent neurons.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Chronic CYP administration significantly ( P < or = . 002 ) increased bladder weight by 60 % and increased ( 7 - to 11 - fold ) the numbers of NOS - immunoreactive ( IR ) afferent neurons in the L6 - S1 DRG .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| CYP |
| bladder |
| NOS - immunoreactive ( IR ) |

Explanation:

* "CYP" is mentioned as being chronically administered, so it is likely a chemical.
* "bladder" is not a chemical, but it is included for context.
* "NOS - immunoreactive ( IR )" is a chemical compound that has been labeled with an immunostain, indicating its presence in the DRG.
